review_title: Good place to work but srinking state funding and shrinking budgets leads to more duties for less pay.
pros: Fun to work with young adults every day.  Great benefits with medical and vacation pay.
cons: Glass ceiling, it's there and hard to break through. Shrinking budget makes people feel volunerable.

job_title: Intramural Sports Official in Tucson, AZ
pros: As a transfer student with interests in sports, working at the Rec Center was a great way to get in contact and make friends with other sport enthusiasts.
cons: Pay is minimum wage for most positions, but increases if you become part of the supervisor team.

review_title: Great Benefits, but lack of mobility
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Tucson, AZ
pros: Wonderful Benefits, good location, fulfilling work
cons: No upward mobility unless changing jobs and locations

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: I have worked at a place where the management i sreally friendly and welcoming. They care about your time and work schedule
cons: It is hard to enter the time into the worksheet sometimes which creares a problem however the college is nothing to blame for

job_title: Food Prep, Cook, Server, Cashier in Tucson, AZ
pros: The hours were flexible to my class schedule and the other employees are fun and competent. There is never a dull moment and there is always something new to do.
cons: Can become stressful during a shift as Einstein's gets very busy throughout the day.

review_title: This place is an example of the don`t do in a professional kitchen from all aspects.
job_title: Senior Sous Chef Supervisor in Tucson, AZ
pros: It is an enormous facility providing state of the art equipment.Has ample staff to provide a full service menus and food preparation.
cons: Too many bosses in one place.No one knows their responsibility.Poor training provided to staff and supervisors.The "good ole boy" mentality must be stopped.

review_title: Pleasant experience working at the Library
job_title: Student Worker At University of Arizona Libraries in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Nice work environment 
Work is not too difficult
Better starting pay than most student worker jobs on campus
Friendly student managers and other staff
cons:
One raise in 3 years
Not very much room for growth
Sometimes the people that you have to deal with are unpleasant

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great place to get a graduate degree. The University is very well respected. Faculty are very knowledgeable and professional, and also very supportive and down to earth. The faculty really is top notch in their field.
cons: it is hot here in the summer for sure!

pros: The college is well regarded in  Tucson and University of Arizona. Salary is above other positions in the University.
cons: Less stability and frequent turnover. In general staff positions and funding impacts positions frequently. Expect to staff in a position for no more than 2-3 years.

review_title: Great place to be a grad student
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Strong earth sciences programs, lots of fun research, quirky small city, low cost of living makes low grad student wages go far
cons: long, hot summers and not a ton of jobs if you want to stay in the area after school

review_title: Recommend other options for growth potential
pros: Fairly easy jobs with limited supervision, can work independently
cons: Salary is low and there is limited or no opportunities for salary increases, staff is not treated well or supported, faculty is given priority

review_title: A good start for students with technical backgrounds.
job_title: Student IT Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: The library is very flexible with scheduling, the team is good at training, job is not too difficult.
cons: Sometimes students would be punished for small trivial error.

review_title: Good university for entry level training as a post-doc
pros: Good university to start off a post doc training but would eventually move to other institutions for additional training.
cons: No post-doc organization.  Not enough guidance or support for post-docs

review_title: Great experience, paid well and treated well.
pros: Experience for future careers, academic environment, diverse environment, accepting to all cultures and lifestyles.
cons: No ability to give raises, huge company so the departments do not communicate well between each other, drama.

review_title: Not in tune with contemporary museums
pros: Arizona State Museum has great collections and the benefits of being part of the University of Arizona. Employees are dedicated and passionate.
cons: Arizona State Museum is caught between its mandated archaeological permitting duties, research, collections care and NGPRA and public engagement museum duties.

pros: Benefits and retirement are like no other in the State of Arizona.
cons: Academia is very politically power driven. It is difficult to have a voice.

review_title: Life as a Grad Student at the U of A
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Tuition and health insurance are also covered.  Great opportunity to prepare for next stage in career.
cons: Job market for academics is really tough right now.  Wages are still often too low to live on.

pros: The UA is one of the oldest and most regarded science university in Arizona.
cons: UA has limited link for its students to the job world.

review_title: Good benefits, but low pay and sluggish advancement
pros: Works around courses, health and education benefits
cons: Advancement moves at a snails pace, pay is well below industry, QTR is taxed at graduate level (Appears like you're earning more than you actually are to the IRS)

review_title: The university is a wonderful nurturing place to work. It was more like a family than a department.
pros: Wonderful work environment, stability, good benefits.
cons: The salaries are significantly lower than in the private sector.

review_title: Research assistant. If you like your research, you will love your job.
job_title: Graduate Research Associate in Tucson, AZ
pros: Good experience. Great way to get through school and get some income at the same time.
cons: Need to set your own goals and priorities or you will not reach your goals.

review_title: Nice first on campus job to start your career.
pros: At the end of employment, you will get a employer discount, about 20 off, not applicable for textbooks, but good for all others.
cons: Pay rate is fixed, about state minimum, $7.25 or something like that.

review_title: One of the great grad schools in Engineering field!
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great atmosphere to study and work simultaneously. Kind people to work with. Gorgeous campus. College town. Great faculties.Best facilities ever.
cons: I think mostly hot weather would be the advantage and disadvantage depending on your preference.

pros:
Flexible Hours
Very easy work
Perfect for students who are looking for a place to do homework and work.
cons:
Boring tasks
Late hours
Having to look for memeber to cover shifts on popular weekends is rough but can usually find some way to do so.

pros: Amazing student work program, allowed for a balance of school and work. With an emphasis put on completing degree before assingments.
cons: "Red tape" could get a little thick, and slowed down potential progress, but to be expected at a university.

pros: Good discount and decent environment for student employees.  Attainable expectations from management.
cons: Not allowed to work more than 30 hours a week as a student employee.  Little room for advancement.

review_title: Overall I have been happy working there
job_title: Senior Systems Administrator in Tucson, AZ
pros: I was able to learn other things, while working through out the week
cons: Overall the pay wasn't the best, but the benefits are great

job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Tucson, AZ
pros: Location, location, location, weather, weather, weather, people, people, people, cost of living, cost of living, cost of living...this is ridiculous
cons: Salary and job security are concerns for employment based on the lack of support for education by the State of Arizona legislature

pros: The university offers significant flexibility for technical personnel largely because they can't keep good ones with the wages they pay.
cons: To make up for the pathetic pay, the state forces employees to pay more than 10% off the top for mandatory retirement.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Tucson, AZ
pros: They work with you on your schedule. Class comes first, then work. They will never schedule work during one of your scheduled classes.
cons: The lack of hours. It's nearly impossible to get to the max of 25 hours per week.

pros: Good benefits and  good people to work with
cons: Unlikely to get raises with reviews. A lot of work expected despite low pay.

pros: Progressive work environment and leader in many aspects to Campus Recreation. You can create your own within your area of Campus Rec.
cons: Sometimes its too slow to get approval on projects but for the most part a very solid place to work.

review_title: Good place to work most of the time
pros: Lots of freedom to adjust how you accomplish the job within the University.
cons: Our department is out of sight, out of mind - does not seems as if the University cares about us or knows that we exist.

pros:
- Great Benefits
- Holiday closure
- Tuition discount
- Love the university
cons:
- Our management has a lot of favoritism
- No professional development in my department
- Bad salary less than $35k a year for someone with a masters degree

job_title: Director of Development, Principal Gifts in Tucson, AZ
pros: Incredible leadership team. Supportive, visionary yet reasonable and with a growth mindset. Train and cultivate talent, focused on bringing out the best in their development team.
cons: State institution results in some issues when it comes to bonus and salary increases

pros: Teamwork and safety are high priorities. Humane treatment by management with respect to hours, overtime, benefits.
cons: Not much room for advancement

job_title: Assistant Research Scientist in Tucson, AZ
pros: Friendly environment and professors are great to work with or help out
cons: Low pay and high amount of work

review_title: As a student this is a great place to work. They are extremely flexible and convenient.
pros:
Works well around student schedules
Fair opportunity for advancement (depending on department)
cons:
It is hard to live off of 28 hours a week
When school is out, hours are sparce

pros: Great working environment if you are a student since supervisors are willing to work around your schedule. You also have access to all library resources which can come in handy.
cons: Minimum wage pay and a small increase as team lead.

review_title: Not many other options if you live in Tucson
pros: Laid back atmosphere; beautiful campus; pretty good benefits
cons: Low salaries; lots of politics and red-tape; campus community split into silos and central communication/organization is lacking

pros: People are nice, and they will teach you a lot of things. Easy working environment with all kinds of holidays
cons: Not that many positions available. There are very few places for entertainment.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate I in Tucson, AZ
pros: State of AZ has a good benefits package.  Cost of living in Tucson is low.
cons: Having your employment dependent upon grant funding can be difficult.  Change in department culture since arrival of new department head - not positive

pros: Laid back culture, even for academia.  Salary is quite competitive even when you consider the cost of living in Tucson.
cons: Large seasonal population, high in school year / winter, lots of students and "snow-birds".  Low in the summer.

review_title: What you would expect working at a public university
pros: There are many great students which makes teaching very fun. Good benefits to help survive off off tiny salary.
cons: Lots of red-tape, poorly funded, very poor compensation, poorly managed departments, no logic behind salaries

pros: Great people to work with, they completely understand you responsibilities as a student and support you. The leadership team is great.
cons: Work wise its too slow as in a academic setup

review_title: Not the best place to work- Biosphere 2
pros: Great medical benefits, most holidays off, paid vacation time as well as paid sick days.
cons: Low pay, limited amount of raises, micro managers, awful communication, employee relations are terrible.

job_title: Student Floor Consultant in Tucson, AZ
pros: They understand concerns of student employees very well. Very helpful and understanding upper management
cons: Salaries for student workers are comparatively less than other universities, however for the city in which it is located, pay rate seems reasonable.

job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great first job for college students. They are very flexible with their schedules and understand that the employees are also college students with busy school schedules.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Good to gain experience but not good pay
job_title: Research Technician II in Arizona State University, AZ
pros:
-Gaining experience
-The ability to work with multiple cores in the laboratory
-Flexibility in schedule 
-Qualified Tuition Reduction
cons:
-It is really hard to get a raise
-Pay is not good
-You might have to learn from a difficult mentor

job_title: Student Admissions Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Flexible working schedule and knowing lots of people in the admissions department. Very nice working environment. Occasionally you are allowed to study while working.
cons: The duties may makes you feeling bored soon after you start.

pros: Working on campus is really convenient, and they always work with your class schedule because they know school comes first.
cons: The pay is not competitive, and because you're a student no one really cares about you.

review_title: Good part time job for students looking to make some extra money during the school year
pros: Flexible hours, nice staff, fun job
cons: Low pay, none other than that

pros: Flexible environment that allows for creativity, new ideas, and synergistic partnerships.
cons: You have to be able to operate in a fast-paced environment and be ok with ambiguity at times.

pros: Relaxed atmosphere where professionals are allowed to do what they know.
cons: Pay is not high but the benefits of great medical coverage, paid holidays and many weekends off are great.

pros: Work/Life balance, excellent supervisor, collaborative environment with colleagues, tuition remission
cons: low salary does not cover entire cost of living, meaning I still had to take out student loans even though I had free tuition.

pros:
Great experience in Marketing/Agency processes. 
Never a dull moment.
Awesome people.
DIverse projects to work on.
Work with your schedule, they understand you're a student.
cons:
Sometimes it gets hectic.
Have a cap on amount of hours you can work a week.

pros: Staff very helpful, always trying to help their students find jobs
cons: Work hours are limited, they only let me work for about ten hours a week.

review_title: Great place for part time student
pros: Great managers, acted as mentors. Was very mindful of my schoolwork and always tried working around my schedule.
cons: Nothing, great experience, learned a lot and took with me after I graduated as well.

job_title: Public Relations Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Great sense of teamwork and shared progress towards both long term and daily goals

Great and friendly management with an inviting open door policy

Substantial amounts of free office food
cons: Really none, this was a lot of fun

review_title: From student worker to Director, I have had the opportunity to climb.
pros: Benefits, including qualified tuition reduction; medical and dental insurance. Great access to mentors.
cons: Lack of diversity in high level positions.

job_title: Principal IT Analyst in Tucson, AZ
pros: UA is a great place to work. The position is stable. You have opportunities to learn database, network, programming applications.
cons: Comparing with the same title IT pros at industry, university IT pro's salary is lower.

pros: Is a good institution, with decent benefits and a good sense of community
cons:
The weather is not very mild, so half of the year is pretty hot.
There should be a bot more engagement towards academic staff

review_title: UA strong on benefits weak on cash and promotion
pros: The benefits are the reason I stay.
cons: No raise in 5 years. Performance reviews are one sentence long. Search for talent is always external instead of nurturing development of skills internally.

pros: Great benefits. Health benefits and ASRS system are good. Being on campus has its perks.
cons: If you are hired as a researcher in a lab group there is little room for upward mobility or raises.

pros: Benefits, young coworkers, intellectual freedom, flexible work hours, Arizona Research Laboratories has excellent upper management.
cons: The pay is low compared to similar work in other areas of the country.

review_title: Quiet, continuously moving work environment in the University of Arizona Libraries.
pros: Work efficiency is based solely on your own effectiveness
cons: Lots of downtime and not enough tasks to keep busy

review_title: It's what you make of it. Plenty of opportunity to connect with the right people.
pros:
Good entrepreneurship program
Programs and clubs that cover nearly ever and all interests
cons:
Not good location for major business
Relatively small town/over shadowed by Phoenix

pros: Good opportunity to learn skills to advance.
cons: Lots of cutbacks as of July 1, 2015.

pros: Flexible hours, beautiful office, staffs here are friendly and helpful. Working part-time really helps me a lot since I am a student.
cons: Student salary does not look nice even I am a software developer

pros: Tucson, university, central city, maybe ok for law economics bioscience business. Terrible for humanities, sciences, arts, and social science - i.e. those disciplines interested in truthful exploration and knowledge.
cons: I find the UA a really terrible place to work. The institution hates its employees.

pros: Flexible schedule along with understanding and supportive management.
cons: Incompetent workforce and ever changing work peers.

job_title: Principal Systems Administrator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Flexible schedule, stable financials, good benefits
cons: Requires accepting a steadily growing set of responsibilities for which no training or salary increases are budgeted.

review_title: Good Benefits / No Opportunities for Growth
job_title: Senior Program Coordinator in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Good benefits
Strong sense of community
Positive work environment
cons:
Things move extremely slow
Job insecurity
University is facing constant budget cuts
Employees are always worried about being laid off
No room for career advancement

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: A lot of opportunities to grow and develop as an individual.
cons: Tucson is not a great city to live in but the campus makes up for it.

pros:
-Flexible hours
-Fantastic working environment
-Friendly managers and employees
-Extremely student friendly
cons:
-Almost impossible to receive pay raises
-Management doesn't provide feedback on work performance
-Hard to move up to higher positions

review_title: postdoc position at U of A
pros: Good environment for those who want to stay in academia.
cons: The salary is very low, almost no job security. This job depends on the funding availability and it ends with the funding.

job_title: Undergraduate Lab Technician in Tucson, AZ
pros: I was able to work around my school schedule and gain very valuable lab experience. I enjoyed everything about my opportunity.
cons: I had no problems with anything.

job_title: Director of Development in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Good team atmosphere. Great town and gown relations. Supportive administration.
cons: Administrative help lacking. State budget always a concern. Overall, pros outweigh the cons. I would go back to work at UA.

pros: Very nice people, a good place to come to work to every day.  Every one seems to want to help each other.
cons: There is a lot of turnover with professional staff members

pros: The school provides students part-time jobs in the library. The schedule is flexible.
cons: The part time job is great, even though the salary is not too high. But the supervisor is nice.

pros: Great if you have a dependant who wants to attend any Arizona state college.
cons: No loyalty to employees. Very political environment. More work than financial compensation.

review_title: Like all teaching assistant jobs, you are a slave in exchange for free tuition
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Free tuition and medical (with an $800 yearly deposit, though)
cons: Slave labor inside the capitalist machine... but hey, at least my education was free?

review_title: Linguistics Graduate Teaching Assistant Pros and Cons
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Pretty flexible in the linguistics department, not high stress from the professors
cons: Students often not very interested, low salary (but most graduate students will be OK with it in Tucson)

pros: lots of social interaction. familiarize yourself with people on campus. good management and upper management. decent pay.  great hours.
cons: some of the desks are more social within the staff than others

review_title: I had a terrific time working as a student here.
pros: fun fast interactive environment that keeps you on your toes.
cons: not able to move up in rank based on company experience.

review_title: A great place to work for a student!
pros: The people are great to work with and they are really flexible with hours, which is a plus for students!
cons: No cons, I love this job

pros: Working on campus has its perks, especially with hectic class scheduling. Environments are friendly and departmental staff are amazing.
cons: Working with the new regulations and restrictions with student employment is a real headache.

pros:
Working with highly intelligent, passionate and motivating people. 
Flexible hours, although the deadlines were very firm.
Very reasonable pay for student-employees.
cons: Working while studying can be overwhelming at times.

pros:
Very nice culture
No formal interaction
Great management
cons:
Low salary
High work pressure
I do not have any other cons, or at least there is nothing that I know of.

pros:
Extremely reduced tuition (waives out of state and cut tuition in half on top of that)
Stipend on top of tuition benefits
Flexible hours to work with school schedule
cons: Often work more than specified hours.

pros: Benefits are great. Postdocs also have good benefits, including 12 weeks maternity leave but only 6 of those weeks are paid. Communication with HR is fast and useful
cons: Garage Parking costs a lot.

job_title: Senior Integrations Engineer in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great benefits, respectful to their employees (but that can vary, the U of A is a large place)
cons: Very political, projects get dropped a lot, lots of wasted time/resources, below averge salaries

pros: Not too hard to get work as a student, but very difficult to get work as a grad.
cons: Asinine bureaucracy, the left hand frequently does not know what the right hand is doing.

review_title: Not much salary in an inexpensive city
pros: Nice working environment in a cute little city
cons: Your experience is highly dependent on who your faculty advisor is. If he is bad, you can live a nightmare

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: It gave me a good opportunity to learn ,better work on effective communications skills as well as give a shot at  lecturing.Overall ,it was a great experience
cons: Compensation could always be better

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Friendly environment, helpful coworkers, laid back workplace.
cons: Some administrative needs take a long time due to slow or incompetent people in administrative positions.

job_title: Student Technical Consultant in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Lots of training so you learn new things every day
Great employees so there's never a dull moment

Slow shifts are boring since no one comes in

job_title: Systems Analyst/Developer Principal in Tucson, AZ
pros: The University has many perks including reduced tuition, library access, and lots of smart interesting people who love to talk about their work.
cons: The pay for developers is not very good.

pros: Great professional opportunity for a student to have. Learned a lot and was exposed to many opportunities through my affiliation with the University.
cons: Not a very high paying job.

job_title: Student Administrative Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great company! The President has been super transparent and understanding during the COVVID-19 outbreak. I would work for them again at any time!
cons: Low pay, but it is understandable for a public institution.

job_title: Manager of Business Analytic Projects in Tucson, AZ
pros: Academia can be fun with the students.
cons: Management can think in historic ways and not as forward thinking

Community

depending on the department, the pay is very competitive
qualified tuition reduction helps cut the cost if you want to take classes
half-time jobs qualify for benefits

pros: Get to work with many bright and enthusiastic student. The position allows for lots of autonomy, provided you maintain the standards necessary to maintain accreditation.

pros: I'm a TA. So, flexible hours.
cons: I don't make enough money as a TA to afford my rent. After adding on a grading position, I barely make enough money.

pros: Great work environment and culture. Good benefits (medical, dental, life, retirement, etc.).
